main event: A winch operator at the Port Chicago Naval Yard spotted a bright light moving faster than any plane and making maneuvers a plane couldn't make over Suisun Bay, California on March 30 and April 1, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a round ball shape that was very bright in color.
The object made maneuvers that a plane could not, such as moving faster than any plane and making sharp turns.
The object continued northward over the water and disappeared from view.
A military aircraft was sent to try to locate the object but was unable to make a positive identification.
The report notes that it is possible some unknown or unidentified object was in the area at the time.
sighted object: a bright light moving at high speed and making sharp maneuvers
witnesses: winch operator at the Port Chicago Naval Yard
